question.text: The vapour pressures of pure liquids <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>are <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>400</mn></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>600</mn><mo> </mo><mi>mm</mi><mo> </mo><mi>Hg</mi></math> respectively at <math><mn>298</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi><mo>.</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi></math>On mixing the two liquids, the sum of their volumes is equal to the volume of the final mixture. The mole fraction of liquid <math><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> is <math><mn>0.5</mn></math> in the mixture. The vapour pressure of the final solution, the mole fractions of components <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> in the vapour phase, respectively are

options.text: <math><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>500</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>0.5</mn><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>0.5</mn></math>

<math><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>450</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>0.4</mn><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>0.6</mn></math>

<math><mn>450</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>0.5</mn><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>0.5</mn></math>

<math><mn>500</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>0.4</mn><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>0.6</mn></math>

solution.text:
Raoult’s law for ideal solution,

PTotal=PA+ PB

PTotal=xA×PA∘+ xB×PB∘

PTotal=12×400+12×600=500 mm of Hg

Dalton’s law,

yA×PTotal=PA 

yA=xA×PA0PTotal=12×400500=0.4

yB=1-0.4=0.6
